name: Darwin/ARM Project
tagline: Porting the Darwin kernel to the ARM architecture.
body:
## Welcome to Darwin/ARM

Welcome to Darwin/ARM. Darwin is the core operating system that lies under both iPhone OS and Mac OS X. It mainly consists of the kernel and various other core components such as `dyld`, `launchd` and such. Over time, Apple has not really paid much attention to their open-source releases as present on the [open source portal](http://opensource.apple.com), including not publishing code for the ARM version of the `xnu` kernel.

This project aims to fill that gap.

### IRC

Feel free to join us in `##darwin-on-arm` on Freenode. 

## Current Status

Darwin/ARM runs on a variety of ARM reference platforms and hardware such as:

* ARM RealView (Platform Baseboard for Cortex-A8/Emulation Baseboard)
* Texas Instruments DM3730 (BeagleBoard xM)
* Texas Instruments Sitara AM335x (BeagleBone)
* Samsung S5L89xx (All ARMv7 platforms from 8920 to 8930).

Currently, the kernel can perform a variety of tasks, including running unmodified binaries from iPhone OS.

### Userspace

Currently, the userspace is very simple, with the FreeBSD `init`, a simple runcom script and a getty. Multiuser does work at the moment. Many CoreFoundation/IOKit apps run at the moment, such as `sw_vers`, or `ioreg`.

The OS is incredibly volatile, so be warned! (There are dragons lurking around.)

### Screenshots

* [`dyld` crashing and demo of multiuser and privilege separation.](http://cl.ly/image/3V3t3511050P)
* [`ioreg`, `uname` and `hostinfo` output](http://cl.ly/image/1L380u0l3Y1w)
* [Multiuser `id` and `pwd` output for home directories](http://cl.ly/image/0z3i1D2k2545)

## Building

Building is relatively simple if you're on OS X, simply compile `ctfmerge`, `ctfconvert` and `ctfdump` from the `dtrace` package. Then check out the kernel source and simply build for your platform using `make TARGET_CONFIGS="debug arm <platform>".

A sample boot loader is also available [here](http://github.com/winocm/GenericBooter) for ARM RealView PB-A8 and OMAP3.

General purpose kernelcache build support coming soon! (Kernelcaches can currently be used, but building is rather unorthodox at the moment)

Have fun and happy hacking!
